intro: Citharexylum standleyi var. mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican citharexylum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
